body: Yes, use an unsigned integer type so that it has well-defined wraparound overflow, and just don't bother trying to force it back in the range. Because `STREAMS_PER_POOL` is a power of two, you won't even have imbalance when you get to the wraparound point. (Actually, it looks like signed integers in std::atomic are defined to uses two's complement, so overflow there is defined too.)
